info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 10:45AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN MECKLENBURG COUNTY THROUGH 1130 AM EDT... At 1045 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Roxboro to 9 miles south of Clarksville to 10 miles northwest of Henderson. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Clarksville, Boydton, Buffalo Springs, Nelson, Rogers Corner, Richardson, Buffalo Junction, Finchley, Eppes Fork, John H Kerr Reservoir, and Skipwith. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
